wikipedia_page.main:
Joseph Harris Wright (born 26 February 1995) is a professional footballer who plays as a defender.
He last played for Doncaster Rovers.

response: Joe Wright is an English film director.
Joe Wright may also refer to:
*Joe Wright (businessman) (born 1938), American businessman and former director of the Office of Management and Budget
*Joe Wright (footballer, born 1995), Welsh footballer for Doncaster Rovers
*Joe Wright (Kentucky politician), Kentucky politician and businessman
*Joe Wright (rugby league) (1908–1967), English rugby league footballer

Cummings joined Scunthorpe United on trial in July 2018. On 14 November 2018, Cummings joined Doncaster Rovers on a two-month deal after impressing manager Grant McCann during a trial spell at the Keepmoat Stadium. Assistant manager Cliff Byrne said that his signing would provide cover for the injured Joe Wright. He played only five games during the 2018–19 season.

On 31 January 2018, Anderson joined League One side Doncaster Rovers on loan until the end of the 2017–18 season. After scoring twice in Doncaster's 3–0 victory over Fleetwood Town at the Keepmoat Stadium on 17 February, he made the EFL Team of the Week. However he was sidelined for two months after fracturing his cheekbone in a 2–1 defeat at Rotherham United seven days later; "Donny" manager Darren Ferguson said that "It's a bad injury but it could've been worse in many ways. He's a tough boy, he'll get on with it". He signed a two-year contract with Doncaster on 17 May 2018. He scored two goals in 33 appearances during the 2018–19 season, having battled with Joe Wright and loanee Paul Downing to partner Andy Butler in central defence; manager Grant McCann had signed Downing in the January transfer window.
